remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!IMPORTANT] > [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] 有下面两个读取器-编写器锁： 和 。The [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] has two reader-writer locks, and . 建议对所有新开发的项目使用 。 is recommended for all new development. 虽然 类似于 ，但不同之处在于，前者简化了递归规则以及锁状态的升级和降级规则。 is similar to , but it has simplified rules for recursion and for upgrading and downgrading lock state. 避免了许多潜在的死锁情况。 avoids many cases of potential deadlock. 另外， 的性能显著优于 。In addition, the performance of is significantly better than . 用于同步对资源的访问。 is used to synchronize access to a resource. 在任何给定时间, 它都允许对多个线程执行并发读取访问, 或允许单个线程的写入访问。At any given time, it allows either concurrent read access for multiple threads, or write access for a single thread. 在资源更改不频繁的情况下, 与简单`ReaderWriterLock`的一次性锁 ( 例如) 相比, 提供更好的吞吐量。In a situation where a resource is changed infrequently, a `ReaderWriterLock` provides better throughput than a simple one-at-a-time lock, such as . `ReaderWriterLock`在大多数访问都是读取的情况下最适合使用写入, 而不是在短期内进行写入。`ReaderWriterLock` works best where most accesses are reads, while writes are infrequent and of short duration. 多个读取器将替换为单个编写器, 这样就不会长时间阻止读取器和编写器。Multiple readers alternate with single writers, so that neither readers nor writers are blocked for long periods. > [!NOTE] > 长时间持有读取器锁或写入器锁将枯竭其他线程。Holding reader locks or writer locks for long periods will starve other threads. 为了获得最佳性能, 请考虑重构应用程序以最大程度地缩短写入的持续时间。For best performance, consider restructuring your application to minimize the duration of writes. 线程可以持有读取器锁或写入器锁, 但不能同时持有两者。A thread can hold a reader lock or a writer lock, but not both at the same time. 您可以使用和, 而不是释放读取器锁以获取写线程锁。Instead of releasing a reader lock in order to acquire the writer lock, you can use and . 递归锁请求增加了锁的锁计数。Recursive lock requests increase the lock count on a lock. 读取器和编写器分别排入队列。Readers and writers are queued separately. 当某个线程释放写入器锁时, 在该时刻等待读取器队列中的所有线程都被授予读取器锁;所有这些读取器锁都已释放后, 在编写器队列中等待的下一个线程 (如果有) 被授予写入器锁, 依此类推。When a thread releases the writer lock, all threads waiting in the reader queue at that instant are granted reader locks; when all of those reader locks have been released, the next thread waiting in the writer queue, if any, is granted the writer lock, and so on. 换句话说, `ReaderWriterLock`在读取器集合和一个编写器之间交替。In other words, `ReaderWriterLock` alternates between a collection of readers, and one writer. 当编写器队列中的线程正在等待释放活动的读取器锁时, 请求新读取器锁的线程将在读取器队列中累积。While a thread in the writer queue is waiting for active reader locks to be released, threads requesting new reader locks accumulate in the reader queue. 不会授予其请求, 即使它们可能与现有读取器锁持有者共享并发访问;这有助于防止读者无限的读者堵塞写入器。Their requests are not granted, even though they could share concurrent access with existing reader-lock holders; this helps protect writers against indefinite blockage by readers. 获取对`ReaderWriterLock`接受超时值的锁的大多数方法。Most methods for acquiring locks on a `ReaderWriterLock` accept time-out values. 使用超时可避免应用程序中出现死锁。Use time-outs to avoid deadlocks in your application. 例如, 线程可能会在一个资源上获取写线程锁, 然后在第二个资源上请求读取器锁;同时, 另一个线程可能会在第二个资源上获取写线程锁, 并在第一个资源上请求读取器锁。For example, a thread might acquire the writer lock on one resource and then request a reader lock on a second resource; in the meantime, another thread might acquire the writer lock on the second resource, and request a reader lock on the first. 除非使用超时, 否则线程会死锁。Unless time-outs are used, the threads deadlock. 如果超时间隔过期并且尚未授予锁请求, 则方法会通过引发来将控件返回给调用线程。If the time-out interval expires and the lock request has not been granted, the method returns control to the calling thread by throwing an . 线程可以捕获此异常, 并确定接下来要执行的操作。A thread can catch this exception and determine what action to take next. 超时以毫秒为单位。Time-outs are expressed in milliseconds. 如果使用指定超时值, 则使用的值是表示的总毫秒数。If you use a to specify the time-out, the value used is the total number of whole milliseconds represented by the . 下表显示了有效的超时值 (以毫秒为单位)。The following table shows the valid 则改用超时值0。If you specify a negative integer other than -1, a time-out value of zero is used instead. (也就是说, 如果无法立即获取锁定, 则该方法将返回而不等待。)如果指定表示负- 1 的负毫秒数的, 则会引发。(That is, the method returns without waiting, if the lock cannot be acquired immediately.) If you specify a that represents a negative number of milliseconds other than -1, is thrown. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用保护共享资源 (一个名为`resource`的整数值), 该资源同时以多个线程的形式进行读取和写入。The following example demonstrates how to use a to protect a shared resource, an integer value named `resource`, that is read concurrently and written exclusively by multiple threads. 请注意, 在类级别声明, 以便它对所有线程都可见。Note that the is declared at the class level so that it is visible to all threads. remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果其他线程具有写入器锁, 或者至少有一个线程正在等待编写器锁, 则为。 blocks if a different thread has the writer lock, or if at least one thread is waiting for the writer lock. > [!NOTE] > 如果当前线程已具有写入器锁, 则不获取读取器锁。If the current thread already has the writer lock, no reader lock is acquired. 相反, 写入器锁的锁计数将增加。Instead, the lock count on the writer lock is incremented. 这会阻止线程在其自己的编写器锁上阻塞。This prevents a thread from blocking on its own writer lock. 结果与调用完全相同, 并且释放写入器锁时需要对的额外调用。The result is exactly the same as calling , and an additional call to is required when releasing the writer lock. `AcquireReaderLock`支持递归读取器-锁请求。`AcquireReaderLock` supports recursive reader-lock requests. 也就是说, 一个线程可多次调用 AcquireReaderLock, 这将每次递增锁计数。That is, a thread can call AcquireReaderLock multiple times, which increments the lock count each time. 每次调用 `AcquireReaderLock`时都必须调用一次。You must call once for each time you call `AcquireReaderLock`. 或者, 你可以调用来立即将锁计数减小到零。Alternatively, you can call to reduce the lock count to zero immediately. 始终立即授予递归锁请求, 而无需将请求线程放入读取器队列。Recursive lock requests are always granted immediately, without placing the requesting thread in the reader queue. 请谨慎使用递归锁, 以避免长时间阻止写入方锁请求。Use recursive locks with caution, to avoid blocking writer-lock requests for long periods. 有关有效的超时值, 请参阅。For valid time-out values, see . ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何获取和释放读取器锁, 以及如何处理请求超时时引发的异常。The following code example shows how to acquire and release a reader lock, and how to handle the exception thrown when a request times out. 此代码是为类提供的更大示例的一部分。This code is part of a larger example provided for the class. remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果其他线程具有读取器锁或写入器锁, 则此方法将会阻止。This method blocks if another thread has a reader lock or writer lock. 有关编写器锁与多个并发读取器锁交替的方式的说明, 请参阅类。For a description of the way the writer lock alternates with multiple concurrent reader locks, see the class. 已具有读取器锁的线程可以通过以下两种方式之一获取编写器锁: 通过在调用前释放读取器锁或通过调用来获取写线程锁。A thread that already has a reader lock can acquire the writer lock in one of two ways: by releasing the reader lock before calling , or by calling . > [!CAUTION] > 如果线程在仍`AcquireWriterLock`具有读取器锁的情况下调用, 它将在其自己的读取器锁上阻塞; 如果指定了无限超时, 则线程将死锁。If a thread calls `AcquireWriterLock` while it still has a reader lock, it will block on its own reader lock; if an infinite time-out is specified, the thread will deadlock. 若要避免这种死锁, 请使用确定当前线程是否已具有读取器锁。To avoid such deadlocks, use to determine whether the current thread already has a reader lock. `AcquireWriterLock`支持递归写入器锁请求。`AcquireWriterLock` supports recursive writer-lock requests. 也就是说, 一个线程可以调用`AcquireWriterLock`多次, 这将每次递增锁计数。That is, a thread can call `AcquireWriterLock` multiple times, which increments the lock count each time. 每次调用 `AcquireWriterLock`时都必须调用一次。You must call once for each time you call `AcquireWriterLock`. 或者, 你可以调用来立即将锁计数减小到零。Alternatively, you can call to reduce the lock count to zero immediately. 始终立即授予递归锁请求, 而不将发出请求的线程置于编写器队列中。Recursive lock requests are always granted immediately, without placing the requesting thread in the writer queue. 有关有效的超时值, 请参阅。For valid time-out values, see . ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何获取和释放编写器锁, 以及如何处理请求超时时引发的异常。The following code example shows how to acquire and release a writer lock, and how to handle the exception thrown when a request times out. 此代码是为类提供的更大示例的一部分。This code is part of a larger example provided for the class. remarks.format: ## Remarks 当线程调用`UpgradeToWriterLock`读取器锁时, 无论锁计数如何, 线程都将进入写入器锁队列的末尾。When a thread calls `UpgradeToWriterLock` the reader lock is released, regardless of the lock count, and the thread goes to the end of the queue for the writer lock. 因此, 在向请求升级的线程授予了写入方锁之前, 其他线程可能会写入资源。Thus, other threads might write to the resource before the thread that requested the upgrade is granted the writer lock. > [!IMPORTANT] > 在调用方法的线程可以重新获取读取器锁之前, 不会引发超时异常。The time-out exception is not thrown until the thread that called the method can reacquire the reader lock. 如果没有其他线程正在等待编写器锁, 则会立即发生这种情况。If there are no other threads waiting for the writer lock, this happens immediately. 但是, 如果另一个线程排队等候写入器锁, 则调用此方法的线程将无法重新获取读取器锁, 直到所有当前读取器都释放了其锁, 并且一个线程已获取并释放了写入器锁。However, if another thread is queued for the writer lock, the thread that called the method cannot reacquire the reader lock until all current readers have released their locks, and one thread has acquired and released the writer lock. 即使在当前线程调用了方法之后请求编写器锁的其他线程请求, 也是如此。This is true even if the other thread that requested the writer lock requested it after the current thread called the method. 若要还原锁定状态, 请使用返回 `UpgradeToWriterLock`的调用。To restore the lock state, call using the returned by `UpgradeToWriterLock`. 请勿将此`LockCookie`与一起使用。Do not use this `LockCookie` with . 当线程没有读取器锁时, 请不要使用`UpgradeToWriterLock`。When a thread has no reader lock, do not use `UpgradeToWriterLock`. 请改用 。Use instead. 有关有效的超时值, 请参阅。For valid time-out values, see .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 每当线程获取写线程锁时, 序列号就会增加。The sequence number increases whenever a thread acquires the writer lock. 如果要确定其他线程是否在同一时间获取了编写器锁, 可以保存序列号并在以后将其传递到。You can save the sequence number and pass it to at a later time, if you want to determine whether other threads have acquired the writer lock in the meantime. 你可以使用`WriterSeqNum`来提高应用程序性能。You can use `WriterSeqNum` to improve application performance. 例如, 线程可能会缓存它在持有读线程锁时获得的信息。For example, a thread might cache the information it obtains while holding a reader lock. 在释放并之后 reacquiring 锁定后, 线程可以通过调用`AnyWritersSince`来确定其他线程是否已写入资源; 如果不是, 则可以使用缓存的信息。After releasing and later reacquiring the lock, the thread can determine whether other threads have written to the resource by calling `AnyWritersSince`; if not, the cached information can be used. 当读取受锁定保护的信息时, 此方法非常有用;例如, 运行数据库查询。This technique is useful when reading the information protected by the lock is expensive; for example, running a database query. 为了使序列号有用, 调用方必须持有读取器锁或写入器锁。The caller must be holding a reader lock or a writer lock in order for the sequence number to be useful. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用属性和方法来确定自当前线程上次持有写入器锁后, 其他线程是否已获取受保护资源上的编写器锁。The following code example shows how to use the property and the method to determine whether another thread acquired the writer lock on the protected resource since the current thread last held the writer lock. 此代码是为类提供的更大示例的一部分。This code is part of a larger example provided for the class.
